decks.notes: The focus of this deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures and vehicles to attack the opponent's life total, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Declaration in Stone and Harnessed Lightning. By efficiently using mana and maximizing damage output with cards like Fleetwheel Cruiser and Skysovereign, Consul Flagship, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast, proactive game plan. Additionally, cards like Pia Nalaar and Depala, Pilot Exemplar provide additional utility and synergy with the deck's aggressive strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with creatures to then be able to bring back with cards like Haunted Dead and Prized Amalgam. The key strategy is to use emerge creatures like Elder Deep-Fiend to disrupt opponent's game plan while also applying pressure with aggro creatures like Insolent Neonate and Scrapheap Scrounger. The deck also includes ways to refill the hand with Cathartic Reunion and Cryptbreaker and has some control elements with Kozilek's Return and Wretched Gryff. The mana base is optimized for consistency and utilizing emerge abilities with Sanctum of Ugin.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to put early pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Gnarlwood Dryad, Grim Flayer, and Sylvan Advocate, supported by removal spells like Grasp of Darkness. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Noxious Gearhulk and Verdurous Gearhulk to close out games quickly. Liliana, the Last Hope provides additional value by recurring creatures from the graveyard. Traverse the Ulvenwald helps to find the right creature when needed, while cards like Tireless Tracker and Ishkanah, Grafwidow provide flexibility in different matchups. Smuggler's Copter is included for additional card selection and evasion.

The main idea of this deck is to swarm the board with aggressive creatures like Bomat Courier, Scrapheap Scrounger, and Inventor's Apprentice, while using efficient removal spells like Fiery Temper and Unlicensed Disintegration to control the opponent's threats. Key to the City helps to get through enemy defenses, while cards like Pia Nalaar and Fleetwheel Cruiser provide additional damage and evasion. With a mix of versatile creatures and burn spells, this Rakdos Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently in a 1 vs 1 Standard format.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to establish a strong board presence early on with efficient creatures like Toolcraft Exemplar and Pia Nalaar, supported by powerful planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar. This deck aims to pressure the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing cards like Reckless Bushwhacker and Fleetwheel Cruiser to deal significant damage quickly. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Harnessed Lightning and Declaration in Stone to control the opponent's board and keep the pressure up.

This Boros Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast and aggressive creatures and damaging spells. By utilizing cards like Toolcraft Exemplar, Veteran Motorist, and Depala, Pilot Exemplar, the deck can quickly build a board presence and deal significant damage. Cards like Skysovereign, Consul Flagship and Fleetwheel Cruiser provide additional power and evasion to finish off opponents. Declaration in Stone helps to deal with opponent's threats, while Smuggler's Copter helps with card selection and evasion. Overall, the deck focuses on being proactive and efficient in dealing damage to the opponent.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure to the opponent through aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By playing threats like Smuggler's Copter, Fleetwheel Cruiser, and Needle Spires, backed up by creatures that provide additional value like Depala, Pilot Exemplar and Pia Nalaar, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game. The inclusion of cards like Declaration in Stone and Selfless Spirit offer additional answers and protection to help maintain the aggressive tempo of the deck.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay. It aims to quickly develop a strong board presence by playing cheap, efficient creatures like Hanweir Garrison, Inventor's Apprentice, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Thraben Inspector. Supporting cards like Pia Nalaar, Thalia, Heretic Cathar, and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar provide additional value and combat capabilities. The deck includes a balanced mix of Mountains and Plains for mana consistency, with additional mana-fixing provided by Aether Hub and Inspiring Vantage. Key spells like Harnessed Lightning and Declaration in Stone offer removal and disruption, while Smuggler's Copter and Fleetwheel Cruiser give the deck evasion and reach.

The primary strategy of this Bant Aggro deck is to quickly build a board presence and control the game through efficient removal and tempo plays. The deck focuses on deploying creatures like Sylvan Advocate and Tireless Tracker, backed up by spells like Declaration in Stone and Reflector Mage to disrupt the opponent's plans. Tamiyo, Field Researcher provides card advantage and additional utility, while cards like Spell Queller and Blossoming Defense offer protection and further disruption. Overall, this deck aims to pressure the opponent early and maintain momentum throughout the game.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive creatures and equipment to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes low-cost creatures like Inventor's Apprentice and Thraben Inspector, along with equipment like Captain's Claws and Bone Saw, to deal damage quickly. The deck also includes vehicles like Smuggler's Copter and Fleetwheel Cruiser for additional aggression. Declaration in Stone provides removal for problematic creatures, while cards like Falkenrath Gorger and Pia Nalaar offer additional value. The deck aims to establish board presence early and apply pressure throughout the game.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence and applying pressure on the opponent. By playing efficient and low-cost creatures like Thraben Inspector and Toolcraft Exemplar, supported by vehicles such as Smuggler's Copter and Fleetwheel Cruiser, the deck aims to deal damage swiftly and overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Selfless Spirit and Declaration in Stone provide protection and removal options, while cards like Depala, Pilot Exemplar and Skysovereign, Consul Flagship offer additional power and utility. The goal is to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost creatures and vehicles to pressure the opponent and deal damage efficiently. It also includes removal spells to control the board and maintain aggression. The synergy between the creatures and vehicles allows for a fast and aggressive start, applying constant pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize, utilizing the Boros colors for a balanced mix of aggression and removal. The key concept is to maintain a fast and aggressive tempo while controlling the board to secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to maintain control of the game by utilizing removal spells and powerful creatures to dominate the board. By using cards like Grasp of Darkness, Ruinous Path, and Liliana, the Last Hope, the player can eliminate threats from the opponent while gradually building up their own board presence. Cards like Traverse the Ulvenwald and Grapple with the Past help to find key creatures like Ishkanah, Grafwidow and Emrakul, the Promised End, which can quickly turn the tide of the game in the player's favor.

This deck focuses on disruption and removal to control the opponent's board while using cards like Grapple with the Past and Traverse the Ulvenwald to fill the graveyard and find key threats like Emrakul, the Promised End. Liliana, the Last Hope provides additional removal and card advantage, while creatures like Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet and Noxious Gearhulk help stabilize the board. The deck also utilizes powerful land creatures like Hissing Quagmire and Sylvan Advocate to pressure the opponent while maintaining control. Overall, the deck aims to grind out value and outlast the opponent through attrition.

The main idea of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures and spells. Key to the City helps with card draw and making creatures unblockable, while Fleetwheel Cruiser and Smuggler's Copter provide additional damage and evasion. Fiery Temper, Unlicensed Disintegration, and Incendiary Flow offer removal options and direct damage to control the board. Pia Nalaar, Inventor's Apprentice, Scrapheap Scrounger, and Bomat Courier are all efficient creatures that can apply pressure early in the game. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistent casting of its spells and creatures.

The deck focuses on combining efficient creatures with powerful support cards to quickly overwhelm opponents. By using cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Smuggler's Copter to strengthen and protect creatures like Verdurous Gearhulk and Sylvan Advocate, the deck aims to create a fast and aggressive board presence. Additionally, cards like Always Watching and Blossoming Defense provide additional buffs and protection to keep the pressure on the opponent. With a balance of threats and support cards, the deck aims to establish dominance early and maintain it throughout the game.

This Bant Control deck focuses on taking control of the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers such as Gideon, Ally of Zendikar, Nissa, Vital Force, and Tamiyo, Field Researcher. It also incorporates removal spells like Descend upon the Sinful and Stasis Snare to deal with threats on the board. The deck aims to stabilize the game with cards like Blessed Alliance and Filigree Familiar while setting up a win condition with cards like Emrakul, the Promised End and Ishkanah, Grafwidow. The mana base is built to support the three-color combination of white, green, and blue.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly swarm the board with low-cost creatures like Thraben Inspector, Inventor's Apprentice, and Toolcraft Exemplar, and buff them with cards like Reckless Bushwhacker. Cards like Servo Exhibition and Pia Nalaar also provide additional creatures to help maintain pressure on the opponent. Smuggler's Copter helps with card selection and evasion, while Incendiary Flow and Declaration in Stone provide removal options. The deck aims to be fast and aggressive, overwhelming opponents before they have a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on early aggression and efficient creatures to quickly take control of the board. It utilizes cards like Smuggler's Copter, Always Watching, and Bomat Courier to maintain pressure on the opponent while generating card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Reckless Bushwhacker and Gryff's Boon provide additional ways to push through damage and close out the game quickly. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early threats and maintain its momentum throughout the game.

The main idea behind this Boros Aggro deck is to prioritize attacking quickly and efficiently with a mix of creatures and vehicles. By using cards like Smuggler's Copter, Fleetwheel Cruiser, and Needle Spires, you can maintain pressure on your opponent while also controlling the board with removal spells like Declaration in Stone and Harnessed Lightning. The deck aims to aggressively build a board presence with strong creatures like Depala, Pilot Exemplar, and Toolcraft Exemplar to overwhelm your opponent and secure victory through early damage and aggression.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage. It utilizes a combination of counterspells like Spell Shrivel and Revolutionary Rebuff, removal spells like Aether Meltdown and Spatial Contortion, and powerful finishers like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes card draw in the form of Anticipate and Hedron Archive to ensure consistent access to resources. By controlling the board and outvaluing opponents, the deck aims to win the game through attrition and overwhelming late-game threats.

The deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through aggressive creatures like Stormchaser Mage and Thermo-Alchemist, supported by burn spells like Incendiary Flow and Collective Defiance. The goal is to maintain pressure on the opponent while utilizing card draw and discard effects from cards like Tormenting Voice and Chandra, Torch of Defiance. The inclusion of Fevered Visions helps to further punish opponents for drawing cards, making it difficult for them to keep up with the deck's fast pace. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Fiery Temper and Galvanic Bombardment to deal with opposing threats.

The deck focuses on building a strong aggressive board presence with creatures like Spell Queller, Archangel Avacyn, and Selfless Spirit while maintaining control with cards like Stasis Snare and Harnessed Lightning. The deck also includes counter spells like Revolutionary Rebuff to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of cards like Glimmer of Genius and Torrential Gearhulk provide card advantage and flexibility in gameplay. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to all three colors (White, Blue, Red) while also including utility lands like Needle Spires and Wandering Fumarole.

The main focus of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing a combination of removal spells, board wipes, and powerful planeswalkers. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while establishing a strong board presence with creatures like Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar. Additionally, the deck includes supportive cards like Thalia's Lancers and Archangel Avacyn to provide flexibility and resilience. With a mix of removal, disruption, and powerful threats, this Orzhov Control deck seeks to dictate the pace of the game and ultimately secure victory through superior board state and card advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost, aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Key to the City helps to enable unblockable attacks and card draw, while Smuggler's Copter provides evasion and card filtering. The goal is to maintain pressure on the opponent by constantly attacking and using burn spells like Fiery Temper, Incendiary Flow, and Unlicensed Disintegration to clear blockers and finish off the opponent. Lupine Prototype and Reckless Bushwhacker provide additional ways to push damage through, while the mana base ensures consistent access to the necessary colors.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent using low-cost creatures and burn spells. The key strategy involves using Key to the City to make unblockable attacks and draw cards, while also utilizing cards like Smuggler's Copter and Fiery Temper for additional damage. The deck aims to maintain a fast and consistent offensive pressure, with the ability to deal direct damage through spells like Unlicensed Disintegration and Alms of the Vein. The mana base is optimized for a smooth curve of plays to maximize efficiency and aggression.

The main focus of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures and powerful spells. Key to the City and Fleetwheel Cruiser provide ways to push damage through, while cards like Unlicensed Disintegration and Incendiary Flow offer removal options. The deck also includes cards like Fiery Temper and Pia Nalaar for additional burn damage. The goal is to efficiently deal damage to the opponent's life total and quickly close out the game before they can stabilize.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. The key strategy is to play efficient creatures like Bomat Courier and Scrapheap Scrounger early on, followed by continuous damage from cards like Fiery Temper and Incendiary Flow. The inclusion of vehicles like Smuggler's Copter adds versatility and extra damage potential. Chandra, Torch of Defiance provides additional burn and card advantage. The deck aims to close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful planeswalkers. By utilizing a mix of efficient creatures like Verdurous Gearhulk and Sylvan Advocate, as well as card advantage generators like Thraben Inspector and Tireless Tracker, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent while maintaining board presence. The inclusion of cards like Fairgrounds Warden and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar helps to control the board and protect key creatures. Overall, the deck focuses on fast, efficient aggression while maintaining card advantage and board control.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly develop a strong board presence by playing efficient creatures like Verdurous Gearhulk, Sylvan Advocate, and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar. Utilizing cards like Fairgrounds Warden and Smuggler's Copter to control the opponent's board while pushing damage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and pressure them to deal with threats quickly or risk falling behind. Additional protection and buffs are provided by cards like Blossoming Defense and Always Watching to ensure the deck's creatures can hit hard and survive longer in combat.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize energy-generating cards like Aetherworks Marvel and Puzzleknots to power out high-cost Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul and Ulamog quickly. The deck also includes removal spells like Kozilek's Return and Harnessed Lightning to control the board until the combo can be set up. The deck aims to ramp up its energy production early in the game and then use Aetherworks Marvel to cheat out powerful threats like Emrakul and Ulamog to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is focused on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and generating card advantage. It includes a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to maintain control over the board. Additionally, the deck features powerful finishers in the form of Torrential Gearhulk and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar to close out the game once the opponent has been sufficiently controlled. This deck aims to outvalue the opponent and win through attrition by efficiently managing resources and disrupting the opponent's game plan.
